meanings.definition: A minor trend within a larger trend.
meanings.sent1: In the world of fashion, subtrends like neon colors or animal prints often emerge.
meanings.sent2: Economists study subtrends to understand the overall direction of the market.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone was following the main trend of wearing hats, but John stood out with his subtrend of wearing a feather boa as a belt.
meanings.sent4: Just like ripples in a pond, subtrends can create a ripple effect on the main trend.
meanings.sent5: The subtrends of online shopping and fast fashion have revolutionized the retail industry.

meanings.definition: To exhibit minor trends within a larger trend.
meanings.sent1: The data clearly shows that the company is starting to subtrend towards sustainable practices.
meanings.sent2: As social media influencers continue to subtrend towards minimalism, more people are decluttering their homes.
meanings.sent3: The cat subtrends towards sleeping in the sunniest spot in the house, even if it means moving around all day.
meanings.sent4: Her unique style subtrends towards mixing vintage pieces with modern accessories.
meanings.sent5: The music industry is subtrending towards streaming platforms as the primary way to release new songs.
